abstract: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Deutsche Bank were chosen to lead the government’s huge first sale of its A.I.G. holdings, expected in mid-May.
snippet: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Deutsche Bank were chosen to lead the government’s huge first sale of its A.I.G. holdings, expected in mid-May.
lead_paragraph: 7:20 p.m. | Updated The American International Group and the Treasury Department have selected four big banks to lead the first sale of the government’s extensive stock holdings in the bailed-out insurer, people briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

headline.main: A.I.G. and Treasury Pick 4 Banks for Big Stock Sale

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
